metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2891 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
strongSwan before 5.1.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and IKE daemon crash) via a crafted ID_DER_ASN1_DN ID payload.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2891` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2
libstrongswan - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.1.2-0ubuntu2

notes.Note: jdstrand> public commit but CVE assignment not public

criterions.comment: strongswan package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.2-0ubuntu2').
